page.title: 01SUMMARY OF CAMBORNE
page.content: {Camborne}is one of the largest towns in West Cornwall.It stands 3 miles West of Redruth, 2 miles South of the North Cliffs & on the main road & rail routes. The population of Camborne at the last census was found to be{18,615. {At the end of March}1974 its rateable value was{Â£3,795,481.}Market day is Friday, & Thursday is "early closing" day.The mean temp is{283 K.}Camborne is probably the most important town in Cornwall for its educational facilities at Pool. Although there is a parish church dedicated to St Martin & St Merridoc, Methodism is very strong in the area & there are many Weslyan chapels. As well as being a major{industrial {centre}Camborne claims a large portion of the{tourist industry.
